;中美必须尽快恢复军事对话以重建信任，外国外交官和专家表示，缺乏这种能力已成为该地区国家的主要担忧。

;

;美国前总统巴拉克·奥巴马(Barack Obama)领导下的美国驻亚洲事务高级外交官丹尼尔·拉塞尔(Daniel Russel)表示，中国与中国之间的安全僵局美国已成为影响地区稳定和复苏的“最乌云”。

;

;“我在北京听到的关于‘某个国家’的说法与我在华盛顿听到的有不同寻常的相似之处，”拉塞尔说。现任亚洲协会政策研究所 (ASPI) 负责国际安全和外交事务的副总裁，在世界和平论坛的一次小组讨论中向北京的学者和外交官表示。

;

;在战略竞争加剧的情况下，北京和华盛顿互相指责对方违反国际法，谋求霸权，损害发展中国家利益以及地区和平与稳定。

;

;“这表明美国和中国已经相互猜疑，越来越敌对的国家，”他说。

;

;“每个政府都认为自己正在保护现状及其合法权利。但由于对方政府的行为受到干扰，双方都认为自己的行为是合法的、防御性的。”

;

;王毅指责美国加剧中日韩之间的紧张关系

;

;拉塞尔表示，如果没有对话、信任和透明度，华盛顿和北京之间的关系就会陷入螺旋式下降，对方的战略意图就会受到质疑，引发周边国家的严重担忧。

;

;“一场危机”尽管双方都不愿意，但很可能导致冲突。”他警告说。

;

;美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯两周前对北京进行了一次高风险的访问，缓解了一些紧张局势，之后做出了这一评估。自从美国击落了当时所说的中国间谍气球以来，双边积怨已使高层外交对话陷入僵局近五个月。

;

;上周，五角大楼表示，中国气球飞越了2月份从阿拉斯加到东海岸的大陆，没有收集到任何情报信息。

;

;北京周一宣布，美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦(Janet Yellen)可能会进一步缓解世界两大经济体之间的紧张关系。将于周四前往中国。

;

;虽然北京和华盛顿之间最新的高层互动被广泛认为对该地区其他国家有利，因为这些国家担心陷入两国之间的政治交火，但深感担忧外交官和观察人士称，两国军队之间缺乏高层对话，因此仍然存在分歧。

;

;新加坡驻华大使陈彼得表示，布林肯对北京的访问是“一个令人鼓舞的事态发展”，引起“一些谨慎”乐观”。

;

;然而，他补充说，双方应“保持开放和有效的沟通渠道……无论这些渠道和平台是在公共领域还是闭门进行” .

;

;“对话是建立相互理解、弥合分歧的基础，”谭说。

;

;即使分歧不可能一夜之间得到解决，大国“也负有重大责任”。他补充道，“保持稳定的关系并相互达成妥协”。

;

;一个令人担忧的迹象反映了大国之间的安全担忧，“许多国家在与世界交往时越来越重视国家安全考虑”，

;

;中国与人工智能：美国为何力争夺回联合国教科文组织席位

;

;斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所的数据显示，亚洲和大洋洲国家总共花费了去年两国的武装部队开支为 5,750 亿美元，比 2021 年增长 2.7%，比十年前增长 45%。

;

;拉塞尔表示，华盛顿和北京应该“尝试一切手段”来减少信任赤字，而一个“非常重要”的工具就是找到让军官相互了解的方式，以减少误解。

;

;自美国前众议院议长南希·佩洛西访问以来，中美军队之间的对话已暂停去年夏天的台湾。据报道，布林肯在北京访问期间试图说服中方重新开放高层军事通讯，但未能成功。

;

;“这些是战士，他们为最坏的情况做好了准备。但最糟糕的是，如果出现错误、误解或误判，最终导致危机，”拉塞尔说。

;Bryan Ong 在新加坡长大。他的成长经历绝非典型。

;

;他的父亲穆雷 (Murray) 是一名海员，经常前往巴西，梦想将巴西的电力派对带到这个城邦。 1998 年，Ong 9 岁时，他的父亲开了一家夜总会，并根据波萨诺瓦歌曲《来自伊帕内玛的女孩》将其命名为伊帕内玛。

;

;但真正让这家夜总会以及 Ong 的童年与众不同的是俱乐部的位置.

;

;Ipanema 位于新加坡乌节大厦。在其鼎盛时期，这座建筑遍布着舞厅酒吧、脱衣舞俱乐部和迪斯科舞厅，吸引了成群结队的人们前来寻求欢乐。在当地，它被称为“妓女四层楼”。

;

;“90 年代，我在乌节大厦的一个托儿中心长大，”Ong 说。 “已经挤满了人。到处都是人，四层楼都有人。”

;

;乌节大厦自那以后就“大幅降温”，Ong 说。它仍然是新加坡最著名的非官方红灯区的所在地，自由职业性工作者在那里从事他们的生意，但时间已经不多了。

;

;八月份，当局开始强制关闭乌节大厦的夜总会 - 以及伊帕内玛也不例外。警方告诉当地报纸《海峡时报》，出于对“公共安全、犯罪活动和滋扰”的担忧，警方决定取消夜总会。

;

;现在乌节大厦正在改造成另一个社区购物中心，一些新租户填补了空置的空间，出售古董、地毯和相框。即使新人群涌入，夜总会老板和依赖乌节大厦收入的性工作者的生计也受到威胁。

;

;性、水疗、肮脏：新加坡乌节路隐藏的东西在众目睽睽之下

;

;新加坡警察部队拒绝对此事发表评论。

;

;最近的一个周二晚上，Ong 在伊帕内玛夜总会的搬出派对上接受了采访。

;

;当时是晚上 11 点，夜总会是大楼里最繁忙的地方，数十名参加聚会的人跳舞、喝啤酒，并在盘中盛满闭幕派对自助餐的食物。与乌节大厦的名声相反，这家夜总会给人的印象并不低俗。

;

;“新加坡相当贫瘠，所以拥有像乌节大厦这样的场所给它带来了一些优势，一种有趣的元素，”Ong，现在33、那天晚上的聚会上说。他家族的夜生活业务已发展到包括乌节大厦 (Orchard Towers) 的另一家酒吧，现在他管理着整个业务。

;

;这座建筑长期以来一直被认为是危险的，这主要是因为那里发生了两起备受瞩目的谋杀案。 2002 年和 2019 年。但近年来，乌节大厦的暴力犯罪有所减少，自去年宣布即将关闭夜总会以来，只报告了一起斗殴事件。

;

;Ong 表示，乌节大厦的不仅仅是肮脏的地方。声誉。

;

;“夜生活行业维系着很多家庭，”他说。 “新加坡的生活水平非常高。夜生活行业允许人们从事第二份工作。”

;

;Abe Isaac 是一家名为 Naughty Girl 的夜总会的老板。 20 世纪 70 年代，艾萨克的父亲将乌节大厦的一家百货商店改造成一家受欢迎的夜总会。 “那是一家 R&B 酒吧，美国水手过去常常去那里。这是一个派对俱乐部，当时我们有全美国乐队在那里表演。”艾萨克在电话中说道。

;

;新加坡严厉打击出租公寓中的“弹出式”妓院

;

;随着乌节大厦周围地区发展成为充满豪华购物中心和五星级酒店的高端飞地，乌节大厦却反其道而行之：它变得更加粗俗和肮脏。

;

;经过几十年的努力为了让夜总会不再发生争吵，艾萨克现在面临着新的挑战：维持他的生意。他估计，接管另一个场馆并维持运营将花费 40 万至 50 万新元（约 30 万美元至 37.5 万美元）。他说，银行对于是否要把这笔钱借给夜总会犹豫不决。

;

;当局要求他在 7 月 31 日之前搬出。

;

;“我走遍了新加坡，但没有找到合适的地方。”去处。我的俱乐部占地 4,000 平方英尺，有现场乐队、舞台和全新加坡人才，”Isaac 说。

;

;“乌节大厦花了 40 年时间才成为享誉全球的娱乐中心世界。但它在短短几个月内就消失了，摧毁了整个行业。”他补充道。

;

;在新加坡，性工作者必须申请黄卡，这允许他们在芽笼市的妓院工作

;

;但根据 Project X（一家自 2008 年以来一直支持新加坡性工作者的非营利组织）的说法，获得这张卡的资格有很多规则。工人年龄必须在 21 至 35 岁之间，不能是男性，并且必须来自经批准的国家/地区名单。性工作者也不被允许与新加坡人发生恋爱关系。

;

;多年来，许多性工作者在芽笼以西几英里的乌节大厦看到了更多的机会。它被称为新加坡的非官方红灯区。

;

;中国大陆如何爱上和失去新加坡的芽笼

;

;Project X 执行董事 Vanessa Ho 讲述了其影响关闭的范围远远超出了夜总会老板的范围。 “自 90 年代以来，乌节大厦一直是成人娱乐场所。工作者有不同类型：酒吧女服务员、保镖、调酒师、厨师、音乐家、表演者、色情舞者，当然，还有性工作者、色情按摩师和街头性工作者。”他们的生计都会受到影响。

;

;何说，乌节大厦的性工作者来自许多国家，包括肯尼亚、柬埔寨、阿根廷、澳大利亚和菲律宾。

;

;虽然性工作通过有执照的妓院在新加坡是合法的，但在城市的所有其他地方都是非法的，包括乌节大厦内或周围。

;

;随着乌节大厦夜总会 7 月 31 日的关门日期越来越近，他们丰富多彩的历史依然存在。大楼内颇受欢迎的 Top 5 俱乐部的门上仍然贴满了异国情调舞者和现场乐队的老式照片。

;

;但维持这些场所运营的人们的前景却很黯淡。< /p>;

;“乐队告诉我他们没有其他地方可以演奏，”顽皮女孩的老板艾萨克说。 “我为我的员工感到难过——他们能去哪里？顾客非常失望。一切都结束了。”

;

;为了留住员工，他计划在改造后的乌节大厦开设一家餐厅。

;

;Ong 在塞西尔街为他的夜总会找到了新场地 –距 Orchard Towers 约 4 公里（2.5 英里），数十名长期客户表示，他们将继续光临伊帕内玛的新地点。

;

;新加坡将出租公寓供爱人用作住宿的男子入狱妓院

;

;至于性工作者，何说他们会看到顾客急剧减少，威胁到他们在乌节大厦的生计。

;

;“这些农民工中的许多人支付高额代理费或者欠他们的代理人债务，”她说。 “收入损失可能会对他们偿还贷款的能力产生严重影响，进一步使他们陷入债务，对某些人来说，甚至陷入贫困。”

;

;在日本有数百年历史的骑马节上，一匹马的死亡引发了人们的关注动物权利组织指控该活动的组织者以“娱乐”的名义虐待动物。

;

;非政府组织生命调查机构上个月向三重县警方提起刑事诉讼，指控与该活动有关的 130 多人。在从视频片段和照片以及活动参与者收集信息后，该组织的创始人矢吹仁 (Ren Yabuki) 表示，他在一匹名叫梅尔祖卡 (Merzouga) 的前赛马在节日期间摔断了一条腿，不得不被安乐死。

;

;这项为期两天的活动挑战来自六个城区的骑手，鼓励他们的坐骑沿着 100 米（328 - 英尺）沿着陡峭的山坡前进，其中包括清理两米高的困难路堤，然后才能进入多度大社神社的区域。

;

;马匹经常在障碍物面前退缩，视频显示旁观者拍打它们当他们接近路堤时，还用绳索、棍棒和鞭子殴打他们。

;

;“在对梅尔祖卡实施安乐死的强烈反对之后，一个由神社官员、县代表、当地警察组成的委员会6 月 19 日，当地居民在神社闭门会面。”矢吹说。

;

;“委员会随后告诉当地媒体，将对包括城墙在内的山丘结构进行审查。”< /p>;

;矢吹集团指控为赛事挑选马匹的六个地区的骑师、赛事组织者、神社官员和工作人员违反了动物福利法。

;

;日本一半以上的动物咖啡馆饲养外来物种：研究

;

;针对节日现场兽医也提出了类似的投诉，声称他没有履行向县当局和警方报告动物虐待行为的职责。

;

;Yabuki 表示，他的投诉得到了视频中记录的 140 起事件的支持，虽然强迫马匹爬上危险的高墙是错误的，但这只是动物权利活动人士反对的一个因素。

;

;他说整个环境对马匹来说都是危险的，而且周围都是对它们大喊大叫并对它们施以暴力的人，这对动物来说也是“极大的压力”。

;

;确保马匹和观众的安全他说，这样的环境是“不可能的”。

;

;“除非明显的虐待行为——用棍棒打马、拳打马、用绳子打马、大喊大叫——被认为是违反《马匹规则》的行为。 “如果没有《动物保护法》，那么这个仪式背后的根本问题就永远无法解决。”他说。

;

;“这个活动已经从传统变成了娱乐，需要尽快结束。”

;

;这个有着近七个世纪历史的节日，由于疫情的影响，今年是三年来首次举办，但当社交媒体网站上出现图片时，它成为了网上批评的对象。

;

;批评者坚称，这个节日最初是人们穿着精致的服装，骑着马在城市街道上游行，来到神社向神灵致敬并祈祷丰收。直到最近几十年（显然是自 20 世纪 40 年代末以来），才增加了路堤的额外障碍，以使节日更加壮观并吸引更多游客。

;

;在一份声明中，市议会相关负责人表示，自2004年起首次收到有关虐待动物的投诉，目前批评意见逐渐增多。该官员表示，没有动物权利活动人士在节日上提出抗议，但补充说，此后“收到了许多人的反馈”。

;

;神社发表了自己的声明，表示已经讨论了马匹的福祉事先与市政府和动物福利组织进行了沟通。

;

;它补充说，相关人员“努力”遵守法律，并且有关马匹受伤的“大量错误信息” .

;

;矢吹说组织者的说法不充分，法律行动是保护预计参加明年节日的马匹的唯一途径。

;一名中国骗子从中国偷走了超过 300 万元人民币（415,000 美元）八名妇女在试图逃跑时被困在23楼窗台上，结果被抓获。

;

;这名男子姓聂，来自中国中部的安徽省，他在一个在线交友网站上认识了受害者，他在网上假扮成一位先生在省会合肥拥有一家成功的家居装修公司。

;

;新闻《四川观察》的一篇报道称，他从 2019 年到 2023 年与 8 名女性建立了关系，在此期间，他骗取了她们更多的钱。总计超过300万元。

;

;从他与该女子的网上对话记录来看，聂某通过在线支付应用程序向其转账数千元，从而赢得了她们的信任。

;

;然而，有一次，信任建立后，他开始借钱，并永久拖延还款。

;

;在微信上与一名受害者的对话截图中，他为拖延辩解说：“公司账户无法转账这么大笔钱一次性收到一笔钱。

;

;“我的账户里没有任何钱了。今天所有的提款都用来支付工资。”

;

;当被问及他声称拥有的钱时，他回答一位女士：“我已经说过数千遍了。如果我没有钱，我还谈什么买房吗？”

;

;上个月，一名张姓女士失去了耐心，要求偿还贷款，这个骗局就破裂了。聂某欠下她30万元，试图从所在单位的窗户逃走。

;

;但他被困在23楼的窗台上，不得不报警求助，结束了他精心策划的爱情骗局。

;

;聂已被拘留，案件正在调查中。

;

;这一消息在中国社交媒体上引起了广泛震惊。

;

; Tue, 04 Jul 2023 09:20:02 +0800 Chinese ‘GaN’ semiconductor technology pioneer Innoscience dragged into IP dispute in UShttps://www.scmp.com/tech/article/3226412/chinese-gan-semiconductor-technology-pioneer-innoscience-dragged-ip-dispute-us?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.04 09:00;
;;

;中国领先的氮化镓 (GaN) 半导体技术公司之一正在接受调查美国国际贸易委员会 (USITC) 在美国竞争​​对手提出知识产权投诉后，对 Innoscience 发起调查，该公司生产硅基氮化镓 (GaN-on-Si)上周，高效功率转换 (EPC) 指控这家中国公司侵犯了与 GaN 晶体管设计和制造相关的四项专利。

;

;氮化镓是传统硅基半导体技术的一种有前途的替代品。 EPC于5月向美国国际贸易委员会和美国加州地方法院提起诉讼。

;

;“EPC提起的调查和诉讼与事实不符，动机和目的不纯”，中国Innoscience 5 月份 EPC 提交文件时表示，并补充说将采取法律措施为自己辩护。

;

;“我们认为 [EPC] 此举是非法的 [步骤]......旨在破坏 Innoscience 的竞争优势该公司补充道。

;

;周一，Innoscience 没有回应美国国际贸易委员会决定对此事展开调查的置评请求。

;

;总部位于珠海的 Innoscience 成立于据中国媒体报道，2015 年，罗巍巍曾担任美国国家航空航天局 (NASA) 的科学家。 2018年，英诺科学在中国多个部级机构主办的创业创新大赛中荣获一等奖。

;

;ASML机器出口新规再次打击中国芯片野心

;

;公司生产晶体管（一种用于放大或切换电信号和功率的半导体器件），并生产晶圆（制造晶体管和集成电路的原材料）。 Innoscience表示，其拥有全球最大的专用8英寸硅基氮化镓晶圆制造能力，每月可生产10,000片晶圆。

;

;根据公司信息，截至去年，Innoscience在亚洲拥有1,400名员工欧洲和美国，并提供市场上最低的硅基氮化镓器件价格，用于充电器、智能手机、笔记本电脑和数据中心等产品。

;

;EPC 正在寻求损害赔偿、停止使用停止令并禁止 Innoscience 在美国销售涉嫌违反专利规则的 GaN 产品。

;

;根据法院文件，总部位于加利福尼亚州的 EPC 与共同创立于2007 年，由 Alexander Lidow 共同发明，HEXFET 功率 MOSFET 是一种开创性的晶体管。文件称，在 Lidow 的帮助下，EPC 于 2009 年成为第一家将基于 GaN 技术的晶体管投入商业化的公司。

;

;在其产品成功申请专利后，EPC 指控 Innoscience 通过以下方式非法获取公司机密： 2017年招聘了一名工程师担任公司首席技术官，并聘请了一名驻中国的EPC员工作为销售和营销主管。 Innoscience 否认了这些指控，称员工的一些工作变动并不构成抄袭。

;

;两家公司均表示，他们的 GaN 晶体管比传统硅基晶体管表现出巨大的性能优势。半导体的进步通常需要在单个芯片上安装更多的晶体管，但随着该工艺达到极限，GaN 晶体管已证明能够以更小的尺寸生产并提高效率。

;

;因此，该技术提供了巨大的潜力涉及下一代设备的开发，例如尖端智能手机、计算机、汽车、卫星和服务器。

;

;中国商务部和海关总署周一宣布，中国将实施出口管制随着北京加强对战略材料的控制，从 8 月 1 日起，将建立包括 GaN 芯片在内的 GaN 技术系统。

;

;据估计，2022 年至 2027 年间，GaN 半导体器件市场预计将增长超过 50 亿美元全球技术研究和咨询公司 TechNavio。因此，在中美地缘政治紧张局势加剧以及华盛顿采取措施限制中国芯片开发的情况下，GaN技术可能会陷入更多跨境商业纠纷。

; Tue, 04 Jul 2023 09:20:02 +0800 Hong Kong’s talent hunt is giving its property market a needed boosthttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3226385/hong-kongs-talent-hunt-giving-its-property-market-needed-boost?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.04 08:30;
;;

;There is much worried chatter in the corporate world lately, and the community in general, that Hong Kong's glory days as a finance and tourism hub and a major business centre were over. The Covid-19 pandemic and subsequent border closure effectively exiled the city from the rest of the world, and sectors all across the economy suffered dramatic, sometimes catastrophic losses.

;

;But as soon as the mainland border reopened in February, the light at the end of the tunnel immediately got that much brighter. As the saying goes, reports of Hong Kong's demise have been greatly exaggerated.

;

;Total tourist arrivals have crept up to more than 10 million for January to May, according to the Hong Kong Tourism Board. Leisure visitor numbers are rising, retail sales and hospitality demand have both received a major boost and meetings, incentives, conventions and exhibition events are on the rise.

;

;On top of that, the influx of professionals and graduates under the recently launched Top Talent Pass Scheme has been a boon to the leasing market. Under the scheme, those who earn HK$2.5 million (US$319,000) or more annually or have graduated from one of the world's top 100 universities with at least three years of work experience are eligible for a two-year working visa.

;

;Expanded Hong Kong talent list reveals professions up for visa fast track

;

;At least 15,000 applications had been approved as of April 18, according to government figures. While the overwhelming majority of applicants have come from the mainland, the numbers from other parts of the world are expected to climb, especially after the Labour and Welfare Bureau expanded the talent fields list in May to include the creative industries, construction, environmental technology and more.

;

;Meanwhile, anecdotal evidence suggests professionals are starting to return. Rents on small- and medium-sized mass market flats are holding fairly steady, though at the luxury end rents have been climbing since January.

;

;Our own data suggests the same thing.今年上半年约70%的租赁咨询和交易来自外籍人士，20%来自香港人，只有10%来自中国大陆，其中70%来自家庭。 It is no surprise that the strongest demand is for properties in the Mid-Levels and the Southside, where many blocks of flats are fully occupied or boast low vacancy rates.

;

;Despite the positive direction and seemingly improved sentiment, challenges do remain. Ten million visitors sounds great, but that figure is about 40 per cent below the same period between 2017 and 2019. Regional competition, a shaky global economy, volatile exchange rates and airline capacities are having a negative effect on tourism here and many other places.

;

;While leasing numbers are strong, thanks to the open border and the immigration scheme, the sales market across the board is likely to be rocky for the rest of 2023.

;

;High interest rates and costs for funds are making institutional investors cautious, and those same rates are weighing on the residential sector.旅行限制的取消给大众市场带来了帮助，但推出新项目的开发商被迫提供大幅折扣，以抵消不断上升的融资成本。 Those factors buoyed the sector to a 120 per cent bump over the year before, but the secondary market only experienced a 19 per cent rise, in addition to sales generally coming in below market value.

;

;The luxury sector has proved fairly resilient, but outside the HK$100 million to HK$200 million bracket, the sector is clearly awaiting the much-needed return of high-net-worth mainland buyers. Hong Kong's market is recovering but not yet fully recovered.

;

;Chances are we won't know just how far out of the woods Hong Kong residential property is for several weeks.夏季是一年中仅次于农历新年的最不活跃的时间，大多数奢侈品买家都会外出度假。 Leasing will remain the beating heart of the market for the foreseeable future as new arrivals opt to rent until they get a better lay of the land.

;

;There is reason for optimism. Policymakers are promoting Hong Kong as the place to be in Asia, while rents, prices and stamp duties in Singapore are skyrocketing.此外，香港是大湾区的基石。 The city isn't off life support just yet, but it seems to have drifted away from critical condition.

; Tue, 04 Jul 2023 08:50:02 +0800 Hong Kong office rents and rental values expected to decline further amid uncertainties about global, Chinese economies, analysts sayhttps://www.scmp.com/business/article/3226425/hong-kong-office-rents-and-rental-values-expected-decline-further-amid-uncertainties-about-global?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.04 08:30;

;Hong Kong's office rents and rateable values are expected to fall amid high vacancies, new supply, uncertainties around the global economy and downsizing by firms, analysts said.

;

;While senior executives want staff to return to the office – and the Asia-Pacific region continues to lead the United States and Europe in this aspect – flexible working as an option is increasingly popular in Hong Kong, according to CBRE.

;

;“Office leasing momentum has remained slow in recent months on the back of prolonged uncertainties in the global economic outlook,” said Marcos Chan, head of research at CBRE Hong Kong.

;

;Vacancy levels rose in the first half of 2023 to 15.7 per cent and will continue to rise as new developments are completed and enter the market, said Chan, adding that rents are expected to edge down by another 1 to 2 per cent in the second half.

;

;Return of mainland tourists lifts Hong Kong retail property segment

;

;The decline in office rents is reflected in rateable values, the annual rental value estimated by the Rating and Valuation Department. Twenty-four out of 33 benchmark office buildings, or 72.7 per cent, last year saw their rateable values fall below 2013 levels, according to Centaline Property Agency.

;

;The rateable values of Hong Kong's grade-A office buildings declined by 26.7 per cent between 2019 and last year, Centaline said, with the Bank of America Tower reporting the biggest dive of 35.3 per cent.

;

;Centaline expected overall rateable values to slide by a further 10 per cent in 2023 “due to the high-vacancy rate of office buildings and the completion of large-scale grade-A high-rise buildings, which cause downward pressure on rents”.

;

;Leasing strategies will continue to be cautious in the short term, according to a CBRE report on the Asia-Pacific office markets published in late June.

;

;“Despite the dismantling of pandemic-related restrictions and a return to normal life, economic uncertainty continues to persist amid rising inflation and interest rates, as well as a slower-than-expected recovery in mainland China,” the CBRE report said.

;

;Singapore stands out with climbing office rents, occupancy rates

;

;Occupiers, therefore, are expected to retain a conservative stance towards leasing in the short term, with lease renewals, renegotiations, right sizing and enhancing lease flexibility among choices available to them, according to the CBRE report. Occupiers are looking especially closely at more flexible expansion and contraction options as well as break clauses.

;

;Occupiers also intend to explore ways to reduce space by exercising lease expirations and consolidating locations, the CBRE report added. Demand from large occupiers looking to sublease space continues to result in elevated levels of shadow space in Australia, Singapore and Hong Kong.

;

;Bloomberg Intelligence echoed the view that Hong Kong office rents could continue to fall in the second half, as some companies might further downsize offices by adopting hot-desk arrangements. This could further depress office rent revenue for landlords.

;

;Why Hong Kong shopping-centre operators are racing to install EV chargers

;

;Financial uncertainties globally could limit demand, particularly from the banking sector, Bloomberg Intelligence said. Major landlords might struggle to fill up their existing office space due to strong competition from a number of new buildings.

;

;And while Hong Kong employees are less hesitant about travelling to work compared with many other gateway markets because of shorter commutes, Chan said flexible working as an option for staff, however, has become increasingly popular, particularly among multinational companies. This also forms part of companies' ESG policies, which promote flexibility and work-life balance.

;

;A Colliers report from late June said that rather than making an office-only mandate part of their strategy, companies need to acknowledge the return will require reasons and motivation.

;

;Many Hongkongers could demand higher salaries to offset losing work-from-home flexibility, according to Bloomberg Intelligence. This could also push major companies to continue offering such arrangements to avoid losing talent.

;Senegal President Macky Sall will not run for re-election next year, he said in a speech on Monday, ending widespread speculation that he would seek a third term his critics said would have been illegal.

;

;Rumours that Sall would try to extend his stay in power have fuelled bouts of unrest since 2021 in which dozens have been killed, shaking Senegal's reputation for calm in a restive region.

;

;“There has been much speculation and commentary on my eventual candidature on this election,” Sall said in a televised speech. “The 2019 term was my second and last term.”

;

;“My decision, carefully considered … is not to run as a candidate in the upcoming election on February 25, 2024. And this, even though the constitution grants me the right,” he said.

;

;Sall's announcement is likely to quell fears of a democratic backslide in Senegal. Some had worried he would follow other regional leaders, including in Ivory Coast and Togo, who used changes to the constitution as an excuse to reset their mandate and extend their hold on power.

;

;Regional leaders including the presidents of Niger, Mohamed Bazoum, Guinea Bissau's Umaro Sissoco Embalo, and the African Union Commission Chairperson Moussa Faki Mahamat, praised Sall's decision, while Bazoum added that it will ease tensions.

;

;Sall's decision will trigger a search for a successor to lead the ruling party just months before the February polls. It is unclear who will run for many of the main parties.

;

;Supporters at his party headquarters in an upscale neighbourhood in the capital were divided on Monday evening after Sall's speech. Some applauded, while others cried.

;

;Pregnant Senegal MP kicked in belly during parliament brawl, could lose baby

;

;“That's his choice, and he is our leader. We accept his decision, and we will support whoever he designates,” a female supporter said in tears.

;

;Unrest last month was sparked by the sentencing of popular opposition leader Ousmane Sonko to two years in jail on charges stemming from an alleged rape – accusations he denies and says were politically motivated to stop him from running in the elections.

;

;Rioters, angered in part by what they saw as Sall's serial sidelining of opponents, torched buildings and vehicles and threw stones at police, who responded with tear gas.

;

;At least 16 people were killed in the clashes, some whose relatives said that security forces opened fire with live rounds.

; Tue, 04 Jul 2023 08:20:02 +0800 About 1 million Hongkongers who haven’t replaced smart ID cards face long waits for appointmentshttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/society/article/3226408/about-1-million-hongkongers-who-havent-replaced-smart-id-cards-face-long-waits-appointments?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.04 08:00;
;;

;About 1 million Hongkongers who did not replace their identity cards during a four-year exercise which ended in March must now wait more than three months for an appointment to do so.

;

;A check by the Post on Monday showed all appointment slots fully booked through to October 26, and it took more than an hour of queuing to enter the government website.

;

;The replacement programme started in December 2018 to give residents new smart ID cards with improved security features. Nine special centres set up for the purpose closed when the exercise ended on March 3.

;

;Transgender activists call for approval of Hong Kong ID card sex change requests

;

;But residents may still apply for their new IDs at six Registration of People (ROP) Offices in Wan Chai, Cheung Sha Wan, Kwun Tong, Sha Tin, Yuen Long, and Tuen Mun.

;

;The Immigration Department told the Post that about 6.84 million residents had replaced their IDs during the programme, accounting for 85 per cent of those eligible, leaving more than 1.2 million who had not done so as of March.

;

;It said appointments at ROP offices had been tight in recent months, since normal travel resumed and there was a surge in demand by residents returning to Hong Kong and others.

;

;Assuring Hongkongers that the older ID cards were still valid, it said the authorities would monitor the progress of ongoing replacements before deciding when to declare the old cards invalid.

;

;The ROP offices offer around 18,000 appointment slots per week for ID replacements, fewer than the 7,700 a day at the nine centres during the exercise.

;

;Accountant Rainbow Leung, 30, who works in Canada, managed to apply for her new ID card last Tuesday after booking her slot in May.

;

;She had hoped to replace her card last year, but Hong Kong's ongoing Covid-19 restrictions for travellers put her off returning to the city.

;

;Leung said she waited online for 1½ hours to get an appointment. She first tried booking a slot at the ROP's Wan Chai office, but it was fully booked.

;

;Other offices had available dates only after a month. She finally got an available slot in June at the Kowloon Office.

;

;People who enter the system each day are allowed to make a booking for the next 96 working days.

;

;Student gets suspended sentence for forging ID card over 'ugly' photo

;

;Design director Wayne Leung, 40, who works in Singapore, said he was also deterred by the travel restrictions and did not return earlier.

;

;He was eligible to make an appointment between January and April last year, when both Hong Kong and Singapore had quarantine requirements for international travellers.

;

;“It would have wasted too much time for me to quarantine for a week in Hong Kong and another week in Singapore,” he said.

;

;Overseas based Hongkongers returning to the city should apply for their replacement ID within 30 days of arrival. The new ID cards are issued seven working days after application.

;

;Applicants wishing to travel outside the city before collecting their new IDs may use other valid travel documents such as passports and Hong Kong Re-entry Permits for immigration clearance.

;

;ID check leads to seizure of HK$7 million worth of heroin in Hong Kong flat

;

;Meanwhile, Secretary for Security Chris Tang Ping-keung told the Legislative Council last week that 750,000 holders of expired Hong Kong passports had yet to apply for renewal, and another 260,000 passports would expire or become invalid by the end of the year.

;

;He said the Immigration Department had boosted resources and manpower to deal with an increase in applications, and was considering extending the period for booking appointments for passport appointments.

;

;A check by the Post on Monday found a 55 minute wait to enter the website to book an appointment for obtaining a travel document, but the quotas were full at all offices until August 3.

;

;Applications filed online, by post or via self-service kiosks and drop-in boxes at eight immigration offices are not subjected to quota limits.

;Bank of China, the nation's largest overseas lender, overtook HSBC for the first time in more than eight years in arranging bond sales in Hong Kong, as investment bankers jostled for a slice of an expanding market while equity offerings slumped to a 20-year low.

;

;Bank of China (Hong Kong) was credited with roles in 110 deals worth HK$49.4 billion (US$6.3 billion) in the first half of 2023 including self-led deals, according to Bloomberg's ranking.

;

;Bond bankers at the lender, one of the three currency note-issuers in Hong Kong, helped arrange Hong Kong Mortgage Corp's HK$800 million issue and China Construction Bank's HK$900 million certificate of deposits last quarter.

;

;HSBC, the biggest banking group in the city, had a role in 128 bond deals, helping companies including Industrial and Commercial Bank of China and Bank of Montreal collect a total of HK$49.2 billion of proceeds.

;

;BOCHK's ranking was boosted by its prolific second-quarter performance, when it surpassed HSBC for the first since the final quarter of 2015, according to Bloomberg data.

;

;“Hong Kong is a major international financial centre with a highly liquid and active bond market, making it very attractive to bond issuers in the Asia-Pacific region and global investors,” a spokesperson for BOCHK said in a written reply to the Post. The bank said it expects the issuance methods for Hong Kong-dollar bonds to become more diverse in the second half, and it will continue to contribute to the development of the city's debt market.

;

;“There was a notable rise in self-led bank issuances in the first half of the year,” said HSBC's Asia-Pacific co-head of debt capital markets Daniel Kim. “Excluding these, HSBC retains its market leading position and we remain committed to supporting our clients with their HKD financing needs.”

;

;The growth of the local-currency bond market underscores the city government's push to deepen and enrich the liquidity of the capital market.

;

;Strategically, “the development of a modern bond market, along with the development of the equity market and the banking sector, will facilitate the efficient allocation of funds, thereby promoting financial stability, strengthening Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre and promoting economic development,” the Financial Services and the Treasury Bureau said in an August 2022 plan to develop the bond market.

;

;Corporate bond sales in the city rose 38 per cent to HK$243 billion this year, as companies turned to fixed-income investors for more capital. A slump in stock prices, marked by the Hang Seng Index's 4.2 per cent retreat, sent new offerings crashing to US$2.2 billion, the least since Sars (severe acute respiratory syndrome) struck the city in 2003.

;

;Hong Kong IPO fundraising drops to 20-year low in first half of year

;

;Companies also rushed to lock in long-term borrowing costs as global central banks continued to raise the spectre of higher interest rates to tame inflation. Despite a pause in the June policy meeting, traders are betting on at least two more hikes this year, from as soon as this month, according to odds compiled by CME Group.

;

;The US Federal Reserve has raised its key rate by a cumulative 5 percentage points since the lift-off in March 2022. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority follows its US counterpart in lockstep in deciding the city's base rate, an obligation under its linked exchange rate system to preserve the local currency peg.

;

;Chinese lender Bank of Communications sold HK$2.7 billion of two-year notes in February, the biggest local issue so far, according to Bloomberg data.中银香港和汇丰银行帮助其他 11 家公司安排了这笔交易。 Standard Chartered's self-arranged HK$1.9 billion of three-year notes in April was the next largest.

;
